file_content.text: [You activate the monitoring station terminal and set it to the Imperial frequency.]
The renegade Jedi are free.
Good. My father will be pleased to hear of our--your success.
I'll give him my report at once. Just as soon as his shuttle comes to pick me up....
[You activate the monitoring station terminal and set it to the Imperial frequency.]
Haddon! Gather your men, worm. Your master has work for you.
I--you're not Haddon. You're Sith.
Wait--you're not Haddon.
Hmph. I guess you'll have to do my bidding, then. Unless you want to defy Darth Atroph's only son.
Atroph? Never heard of him.
Darth who?
No? He's... big. Real big. Practically on the Dark Council.
Start talking.
Er... good. And, uh, apologies for the "worm" bit. Just something to keep the grunts in line.
Don't tell me what to do.
Eh, what's that? Holo's breaking up a bit.
Now then. Prison records indicate several Jedi Masters are being held here. Seems they were investigating a... thing on Voss.
Whatever it was, it corrupted them, drove them mad as mynocks. So the Jedi Council sent them here for safekeeping.
If what you say is true, destroying these Jedi will be even easier than usual.
Sounds like they're helpless.
Yeah, but that'd be kind of a waste, wouldn't it?
The Jedi wouldn't have imprisoned them here unless they were truly irredeemable.
They must be too far gone.
Uh, right. Obviously.
Standard elimination contract, then?
You want them dead?
What? No!
What exactly were these Jedi investigating?
Corrupted? How?
I don't know. My father won't tell me.
Hard to believe.
My father insisted I scan every name in the prisoner registry myself. I'm positive.
How do I fit in?
Have I mentioned who my father is? He cares, which means you should care.
Those Jedi should be out of their cells, running loose, bringing destruction and chaos to this place. That's why you're going to release them.
Only because it's easy.
I expected you'd say "yes," but still, ah, thank you.
I'll play along.
Er, right, whatever I--right.
Not without pay.
Fine. My allowance should cover your expenses.
A warning: The Jedi are being guarded by Master Averon--powerful Jedi, strong enough to overcome the darkness that corrupted his friends.
He's dedicated himself to protecting the others. Avoid him if you can, but slay him if you must.
No, I'm not. [Refuse quest]
My father's going to hear about this!
[This monitoring station appears to be deactivated.]
